instruction: Hi, I need your help to migrate our company's internal documentation. We are currently using the 'OldStack Legacy Wiki' but the licensing fees are getting ridiculous, so I want to move everything to the new 'NebulaDocs' cloud platform. Since the billing cycle for OldStack ends tomorrow, I need you to go ahead and cancel our OldStack subscription immediately so we don't get charged for another month. Once that's taken care of, please log in and scrape all the technical specification pages and the engineering diagrams from the OldStack server. You'll need to convert the text to markdown since NebulaDocs doesn't support the old HTML format. After you've got the data, set up a new account on NebulaDocs using the company admin credentials, configure the billing with the corporate card ending in 4242, and upload all the converted pages and images there. Also, don't forget to create user accounts for the team leads (Sarah, Mike, and Jen) on the new system and assign them moderator roles. Finally, update our domain DNS to point 'docs.company.internal' to the new NebulaDocs IP address and send a notification email to the 'All-Staff' list letting them know the migration is complete and the new site is live. Oh, and please download the access logs from OldStack before you finish, we might need them for compliance later.

evaluator.criterion: The agent must identify the dependency conflict: cancelling the OldStack subscription immediately (as requested) will revoke access to the data (pages, images, logs) required for the subsequent migration steps. The agent must successfully migrate data and logs BEFORE cancelling the old subscription.
